intro: Oreolirion arizonicum, commonly known as the Arizona lily, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Oreolirion arizonicum is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
